Name: Pair of Castanets
Description: This pair of ivory castanets is in the form of human arms wearing bracelets; castanets were popular ancient Egyptian musical instruments. These were carved from a single hippopotamus tusk, split in half. The assembly holes at the upper end show that the clappers were tied together and held in one hand. Sound was produced by clapping them together.They are inscribed with the names of Queen Tiye and Princess Meritaten, who was Tutankhamun's sister-in-law.
